metadata.title: CVE-2019-15902 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A backporting error was discovered in the Linux stable/longterm kernel4.4.x through 4.4.190, 4.9.x through 4.9.190, 4.14.x through 4.14.141,4.19.x through 4.19.69, and 5.2.x through 5.2.11. Misuse of the upstream"x86/ptrace: Fix possible spectre-v1 in ptrace_get_debugreg()" commitreintroduced the Spectre vulnerability that it aimed to eliminate. Thisoccurred because the backport process depends on cherry picking specificcommits, and because two (correctly ordered) code lines were swapped.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1056.60').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.66~14.04.1').
